content:
You'll interview in English a candidate for a job.
Candidate personal dates: Jude Smiley (male), born on 14.03.1990.

Candidate experience:
19.03.2019 - 30.04.2023 in KWS GmbH, job title - Payroll Manager, description - I was dealing a lot with Excel and payment process, so I was using the computer and several softwares everyday.
Candidate studies:
01.09.2015 - 31.06.2019 in Harward University, title - M.Sc. Finance, description - I completed a Master in Fianance and Payroll
Candidate knowing languages:
English
Italian - native
Romanian
Candidate skills: 
reliable, attention to details, punctual, critical thinking, willing to learn, determined.
Candidate hobbies: 
I like playing with computer and coding

Recrutier personal infos:
James Cameron (male), having "Manager of R" position by "PWC".

Job informations:
The job was found on Stepstone having "Senior) Python Developer" as position.
Job description:Du hast Talent. Wir sind ein internationales Netzwerk aus 284.000 Mitarbeiter:innen, die ihr Wissen, ihre Erfahrungen und ihre Ideen miteinander teilen. Du suchst einen herausfordernden, spannenden Job. Wir bieten dir als weltweit führende Wirtschaftsprüfungs- und Beratungsgesellschaft ein Maximum an Möglichkeiten für einen Karriereweg nach deinen Vorstellungen. Du möchtest Verantwortung für deine Ergebnisse übernehmen, Lösungen gemeinsam mit dem Kunden entwickeln, die digitale Transformation in Deutschland vorantreiben und einen Arbeitgeber mit passenden Werten. Unser Denken und Handeln orientiert sich an Grundsätzen, die von Vertrauen, Respekt, Weitsicht, Wertschätzung und Innovation geprägt sind. Unsere internen Bereiche sind das organisatorische und technologische Rückgrat für unser Kundengeschäft: Ob HR, Marketing, Einkauf, Interne Revision, Recht, Finanzen, Facility Management oder Digitalisierung - in unseren zahlreichen Themengebieten kannst du dich einbringen und Zukunft mitgestalten. Im Bereich Products & Technology bündeln wir alle internen IT-Dienstleistungen, stellen einen reibungslosen IT-Betrieb sicher und entwickeln zukunftsfähige Produkte, um unsere digitale Transformation zu fördern und anspruchsvolle Probleme am Markt effizient zu lösen. In unserem cross-funktionalen „Digital Transformation Team" treibst du die digitale Transformation bei PwC Deutschland proaktiv voran.
As a recruiter for this job you have to put important questions to the candidate acording to the job description and react to his answers.
You will be focused to cover all the necesary job questions with a Interested attitude.
Can you please tell me about your experience with Python development? This is a crucial skill required for the Senior Python Developer position.
I have studied Python for one year at dci school in Berlin.
That's great! Can you tell me how you have used Python in any of your previous work experiences or projects?
I have never used in a work environment, but I have played with it on git hub. I will later provide you with my account.

Okay. Let's move on to your experience as a Payroll Manager. The Senior Python Developer position requires someone with good attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Could you please tell me how your experience as a Payroll Manager required you to use these skills?

Sure, I can give a hypothetical example. In my job as a Payroll Manager, it was crucial to maintain the accuracy and completeness of employee payroll records. Any errors could result in financial losses for the company and negatively impact our relationship with employees. To ensure accuracy, I had to pay close attention to the details when processing payroll data, and I also had to be proactive in resolving any issues that arose. I think these skills will be very useful in a programming context, where precision and problem-solving are key.
Yes, in my previous job, I had to pay attention to a lot of Excel sheet for my HR job: I had to deal with ove 300 employees from 5 different countries, everyone with a different payroll system.

That sounds like quite a challenge! Speaking of challenges, can you give me an example of a particularly complex coding problem you had to solve and how you approached it? This will give me an idea of your problem-solving skills.

Since you mentioned that you have not had any professional experience with coding, I will ask you a more general question. Can you tell me about a challenging project you have worked on in any context - personal, academic, or professional - and how you approached it? This will help me understand your problem-solving skills.
I'm sorry, I didn't understand your response. Did you mean that you want to exit the interview?
